summary:
BILL 
a comic collaboration with @theatrelesbabe 
the last time she saw him was at the train station. 
jolly and cheeky as ever,...
body:
BILL

a comic collaboration with @theatrelesbabe

the last time she saw him was at the train station.

jolly and cheeky as ever, he gave her directions and sent her on her way.

how was she supposed to know he would die that night?

how was she supposed to know that she would kill him?

it’s not fair, eve thinks, that her life has come to this. or maybe…. or maybe it makes sense.

the thrill she’s been chasing. the demon she’s been hunting. it’s finally real. it’s finally here.

and it’s a damn shame it’s come to this.

she steps out of her car. her sneakers crunch against the gravel. they’re the shoes she wears before putting on high heels for work. it’s morning. she smooths out her trousers, walking with purpose. it’s not the first time she’s been here, but it is the last.

once you do something as horrible, as irredeemable, as she’s about to do, you can’t revisit the dead.

you can only join them.

his tomb stone is bare. it reads: “pargrave, 1956-2018.” she wants to reach out and touch it. trace the indent of the letters. feel them cave under her fingertips.

she thinks about her gasp. the delicious intoxicating sound she makes whenever eve is near. it stirs something from deep in her belly. something never meant to be awakened. it’s primal. animalistic.

feral.

she remembers her touch. soft and delicate against her cheek. the ghost of her lips against eve’s own. her eyes sparkle. “kiss me, i dare you.”

eve was never one to back down from a challenge.

she drops her hands to her side. the way she feels. the way she wants. the way she needs. it can’t be comprehended. compared against the spectrum of human emotion, it’s all-consuming. it’s everything.

in a sea of addictions, she is the drug eve craves.

how can she deny herself that?

“you would understand.” she hears herself say. her voice is unfamiliar. gravelly. exhausted.

bill, the man who greeted her on her first day with a smile and a burger. bill, the man she sang disney showtunes with while wasted. bill, her best fucking friend.

would he understand?

would he?

he was a thrillseeker too. he was adventurous. didn’t take no for an answer. brave and fiercely loyal.

eve wishes she could be half the person he was.

but would he understand?

she swallows. takes a breath. a shuddering breath.

honey blonde hair. hazel eyes. tall. lithe. clever. so fucking clever. impatient. immature.

irresistible.

she has to believe he’d get it. she has to believe he’d know why she’d take this leap. why she would leave her life behind for just a taste of temptation.

“i’m sorry,” she whispers. drops the yellow daisies on top of the ground. she saw them while walking through the street market the other day. as the assassin bounced ahead, distracted by the food and clothes and people, eve hung back, mesmerized by the flowers. they reminded her of him.

“come on, eve!” villanelle laughed. the most beautifully cruel melody eve has ever heard. she gave the florist some bills, told them to keep the change. then, she picked up her pace, to catch up with the woman she felt she had been chasing forever.

villanelle put her hand out, and eve took it. she knew in that moment, she would always take it. always.

eve turns on her heel to head back to the car. the guilt and shame are overwhelming.

“im sorry. i really am,” she says as she walks away. she tries to look at his name on the gray stone. like looking him in the eye. but she’s empty. she can’t. so she leaves.

he would understand. she reassures herself. he would.

if he didn’t, what would that make her?

summary: why do you think Eve brought backup with her at the Hotel instead of going alone?
question: why do you think Eve brought backup with her at the Hotel instead of going alone?
answer:
So that Villanelle doesn’t escape.

It’s a good question because to me the hotel scene has similar emotional beats as the apartment scene in 1x08 where Eve almost had all of Villanelle before Villanelle escaped with the tiny difference that back then Eve was completely acting on instinct (as she is now but anyways), flying out to Paris by herself and breaking into Villanelle’s apartment with little to no plan on how to actually Catch and Keep the girl. Now, as Eve knows where Villanelle is, she wants and needs to make sure Villanelle doesn’t escape again and arrives prepared; with her team and an armed force to get Villanelle and accomplish her mission.

I really like the build up because Eve’s visit to the hotel comes as a surprise to Villanelle (same as when Eve appeared in the apartment) and Eve means to take full advantage of that against her. But there is always a catch because too bad Konstantin lets Villanelle know that Mi6 is coming for her and Villanelle just so happens to catch Eve through the peephole. So Eve loses her, once more.

summary: Every time a new episode airs and especially with the latest episode of Killing Eve, it becomes so much more this queer ladies...
body:
Every time a new episode airs and especially with the latest episode of Killing Eve, it becomes so much more this queer ladies romance story wrapped up in the spy genre. I love they don’t even play it in subtext at all yet, they STILL never are quite in direct contact and god it drives me crazy but I love it.

Also the continuous guessing Eve, and the audience has of if we can trust Villanelle? But the glory of it is even Villanelle doesn’t exactly know what she’s going to do until the moment presents itself. It is the most erotic queer lady TV show to exist with nothing ever TECHNICALLY happening and it’s glorious.

So far episode 1x05 and 2x03 are better than the whole L word series combined.
